qas.question: What year was game theory established?
What discipline is game theory derived from?
what are the possible strategies in minimax theory?

answers.text: a pair of strategies for both players that allows each to minimize his maximum losses

qas.question: What must a player consider when determining every possible strategy?

answers.text: all the possible responses of his adversary.

context: Von Neumann founded the field of game theory as a <a1_0>mathematical discipline.<a1_0/> Von Neumann proved his minimax theorem in <a0_0>1928<a0_0/>. This theorem establishes that in zero-sum games with perfect information (i.e. in which players know at each time all moves that have taken place so far), there exists <a2_0>a pair of strategies for both players that allows each to minimize his maximum losses<a2_0/>, hence the name minimax. When examining every possible strategy, a player must consider <a3_0>all the possible responses of his adversary.<a3_0/> The player then plays out the strategy that will result in the minimization of his maximum loss.
